data.title: The RAG at the XXXIX investiture dinner of the Grand Order of Knights of Wine
data.text:
On June 13, our president, Luis Suárez de Lezo, had the opportunity to attend a very special event in London as a guest. This is an annual gala dinner that pays tribute to Spanish wines organized by The Grand Order of Knights of Wine and which this year took place at The Landmark hotel and was attended by the Spanish Ambassador to the United Kingdom, José Pascual Marco.

The Great Order of Knights of Wine emerged as an instrument to promote and develop Spanish wines, it was founded in 1984 by the INFE and a group of businessmen dedicated to the marketing of Spanish wine in the United Kingdom. It has become a key element in the promotion and public relations of the image of Spanish wines in the complicated British market and is set to play an important role in the coming years, given the complicated post-BREXIT scenario that predicts competition. increasing popularity of New World wines.

Since its foundation, each year it accredits personalities who have distinguished themselves exceptionally in the promotion of wine and especially quality Spanish wines in this market. All members are linked, directly or indirectly, to the wine sector: winemakers, importers, members of the Masters of Wine Institute, the specialized press and Spanish restaurants in the United Kingdom.

Currently, the Investiture Dinner of the Grand Order of the Knights of Wine is considered the best public relations and networking event on the Spanish wine calendar in the United Kingdom.

In the context of the dinner, the investiture of the new members is celebrated, of which this year there have been three: Almudena Alberca, the first female Master of Wine in Spain and director of wineries throughout Spain, including Bodegas Palacio and Viña Mayor. The writer and wine journalist Amaya Cervera, National Gastronomy Award for Best Gastronomic Communication 2023. And Hal Wilson, a firm defender of Spanish wines and sherries in the United Kingdom, which are promoted in his Cambridge Wine Merchant stores.

Attendees enjoyed a menu prepared by Gary Klaner, the hotel's current executive chef, accompanied by 9 wines chosen from among the 75 wines proposed by potential sponsors, during a tasting held in the Economic and Commercial Office by members of the Grand Order.
